sen.j: 桂宮 淑子内親王（かつらのみや すみこないしんのう、文政12年1月19日（1829年2月22日） - 明治14年（1881年）10月3日）は、仁孝天皇の第三皇女。
sen.e: Katsuranomiya Imperial Princess Sumiko (February 22, 1829 - October 3, 1881) was Emperor Ninko's third Princess.
Katsuranomiya Imperial Princess Sumiko (February 22, 1829 - October 3, 1881) was Emperor Ninko's third Princess.
Imperial Princess Katsuranomiya Sumiko (February 22, 1829 - October 3, 1881) was Emperor Ninko's third Princess.

sen.j: 生母は按察使典侍甘露寺妍子。
sen.e: Her birth mother was Azechi no nashi (lady-in-waiting), Kiyoko KANROJI.
Her birth mother was Azechi no nashi (lady-in-waiting), Kiyoko KANROJI.
Her birth mother was Azechi no naishi (lady-in-waiting), Kiyoko KANROJI.

sen.j: 幼名は敏宮（ときのみや）。
sen.e: Her childhood name was Tokinomiya.
Her childhood name was Tokinomiya.
Her childhood name was Tokinomiya.

sen.j: 孝明天皇は異母弟、和宮親子内親王は異母妹にあたる。
sen.e: Her half younger brother was Emperor Komei, half younger sister was Kazunomiya Imperial Princess Chikako.
Her half younger brother was Emperor Komei, half younger sister was Kazunomiya Imperial Princess Chikako.
Her half younger brother was Emperor Komei, half younger sister was Imperial Princess Kazunomiya Chikako.

sen.j: 天保11年1月28日（1840年3月1日）、閑院宮愛仁親王と婚約。
sen.e: On March 1, 1840, she married with Kaninnomiya Imperial Prince Naruhito.
On March 1, 1840, she was married to Kaninnomiya Imperial Prince Naruhito.
On March 1, 1840, she was married to Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Naruhito.

sen.j: 天保13年9月15日（1842年10月18日）には結婚を前に内親王宣下がなされるも、その2日後の9月17日（10月20日）に愛仁親王の薨去が発せられたため、結婚には至らなかった。
sen.e: She received to title to become Imperial Princess on October 18, 1842 just before she was getting marry however, two days after this, on October 20 Imperial Prince Naruhito died and the marriage did not happen.

She received the title to become Imperial Princess on October 18, 1842 just before she was getting married however, two days after this, on October 20 Imperial Prince Naruhito died and the marriage did not happen.

She received the title to become Imperial Princess on October 18, 1842 just before she was getting married however, two days after this, on October 20 Imperial Prince Naruhito died and the marriage did not happen.

sen.j: 文久2年12月23日（1863年2月11日）、異母弟・桂宮節仁親王の没後空主となっていた桂宮家を継承し、第12代桂宮となる。
sen.e: After her half younger brother, Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Misahito died on February 11, 1863, since there was no one to succeed to the head of the Katsyranomiya family, Katsuranomiya Imperial Princess Sumiko succeeded to become the twelfth family head oh the Katsuranomiya family.

After her half younger brother, Katsuranomiya Imperial Prince Misahito died on February 11, 1863, since there was no one to succeed to the head of the Katsyranomiya family, Katsuranomiya Imperial Princess Sumiko succeeded to become the twelfth family head of the Katsuranomiya family.

After her half younger brother, Imperial Prince Katsuranomiya Misahito died on February 11, 1863, since there was no one to succeed to the head of the Katsuranomiya family, Imperial Princess Katsuranomiya Sumiko succeeded to become the twelfth family head of the Katsuranomiya family.

sen.j: これは女性が当主として宮家を継承した大変珍しい例である。
sen.e: This was very exceptional example of woman being succeeded to the house of an Imperial prince.
This was a very exceptional example of a woman being succeeded to the household of an Imperial prince.
This was a very exceptional example of a woman being succeeded to Miyake (house of an imperial prince).
sen.cmt: "the household of an Imperial prince" -> "Miyake (house of an imperial prince)" に変更しました。

sen.j: 次いで慶応2年4月22日（1866年6月5日）には准三后、一品に叙されるなど、大層厚遇された。
sen.e: After that he received Jusango (one of the respective title for Imperial family or court nobles in the Heian period), Ippon (the first of Imperial Prince's rank) on June 5, 1866 and she was treated well.

After that she received Jusango (one of the respective title for Imperial family or court nobles in the Heian period), Ippon (the first of Imperial Princess's rank) on June 5, 1866 and she was treated well.

After that she received Jusango (one of the respective title for Imperial Family or court nobles in the Heian period), Ippon (the first of Imperial Princess's rank) on June 5, 1866 and she was treated well.

sen.j: 以後、桂准后宮と称せられることになり、座次でも孝明天皇女御英照皇太后（当時准后）より上座とされた。
sen.e: Since then she was called Katsura jugo no miya and her rank of the seating order was higher than Emperor Komei's Nyogo (a consort of an emperor), the Empress Dowager Eisho. (Jugo (same as Jusango) at that time)
sen.cmt: 桂准后宮→Katsura jugo no miya?[読み方確認できず]
sen.e: Since then she was called Katsura jugo no miya and her rank of seating order was higher than Emperor Komei's Nyogo (a consort of an emperor), the Empress Dowager Eisho. (Jugo - same as Jusango - at that time)

Since then she was called Katsura jugo no miya and her rank of seating order was higher than Emperor Komei's Nyogo (a consort of an emperor), the Empress Dowager Eisho (Jugo - same as Jusango - at that time).
She died in 1881 when she was fifty three years old.
She died in 1881 when she was fifty three years old.
She died in 1881 when she was fifty three years old.

sen.j: 同年10月20日京都府京都市上京区の相国寺にて葬儀が執り行われ、同市東山区の泉涌寺内に葬られる。
sen.e: The funeral was held at Shokoku-ji Temple at Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture on October 20, 1881, and she was entombed in Sennyu-ji Temple in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.
The funeral was held at Shokoku-ji Temple at Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture on October 20, 1881, and she was entombed in Sennyu-ji Temple in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.
The funeral was held at Shokoku-ji Temple at Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture on October 20, 1881, and she was entombed in Sennyu-ji Temple in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 淑子内親王薨去をもって、桂宮家は継嗣不在のため断絶する。
sen.e: After Imperial Princess Sumiko died, the Katsuranomiya family discontinued since there was no one to succeed to the family.
After Imperial Princess Sumiko died, the Katsuranomiya family discontinued since there was no one to succeed to the family.
After Imperial Princess Sumiko died, the Katsuranomiya family discontinued since there was no one to succeed to the family.

sen.j: 大変人見知りの激しい性格で、御所の庭を散歩するときにも輿に乗り、簾の間からかいま見るという行動をとっていた。
sen.e: She was very shy and she was in a palanquin while going for a walk in the Palace and looking outside through the Bamboo blind.
She was very shy and she was in a palanquin while going on a walk in the Palace peering outside through a Bamboo blind.
She was very shy and she was in a palanquin while going on a walk in the Palace peering outside through a Bamboo blind.

sen.j: 物怖じしない性格の和宮とは全く対照的だったという。
sen.e: Her personality was contrary to Kazunomiya's who was very outgoing.
Her personality was contrary to Kazunomiya's who was very outgoing.
Her personality was contrary to Kazunomiya's who was very outgoing.

sen.j: その和宮とは一時期同居していたことがある。
sen.e: There was a period when she used to live together with Kazunomiya.
There was a period when she used to live together with Kazunomiya.
There was a period when she used to live together with Kazunomiya.

sen.j: 現在二条城本丸御殿といわれているのが、淑子の住まいであった桂宮邸である。
sen.e: It was Katsuranomiya mansion where Sumiko used to live and it is currently known as Honmaru (the keep of a castle) Palace of Nijo Castle.
It was Katsuranomiya mansion where Sumiko used to live and it is currently known as Honmaru (the keep of a castle) Palace of Nijo Castle.
It was Katsuranomiya mansion where Sumiko used to live and it is currently known as Honmaru (the keep of a castle) Palace of Nijo-jo Castle.

sen.j: 能を愛好していた彼女の好みにより、座敷の一部は能舞台として使えるように改造がくわえられており、今でもその遺構が残っている。
sen.e: Since she loved Noh play, a part of the Japanese-style room was arranged to use as the stage of Noh play, this room is still kept as the way it used to be.
Since she loved Noh play, a part of the Japanese-style room was arranged to use as a stage for Noh play, this room is still kept as the way it used to be.
Since she loved Noh play, a part of the Japanese-style room was arranged to use as a stage for Noh play, this room is still kept as the way it used to be.
